document.docAuthor: Barahona-Segovia, Rodrigo M., Riera, Pamela, Pañinao-Monsálvez, Laura, Guzmán, Vicente Valdés & Henríquez-Piskulich, Patricia
document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 193–196. (193) Fragosa filiola (Shannon, 1927) (photo by Gabriela Germain). Mimocalla erebus (Hull, 1942): (194) lateral view. Scale bar = 2 mm (photo by Rodrigo Barahona-Segovia). Nuntianus confusus (Goot, 1964): (195) female, visiting Oxalis virgosa Molina (photo by Raúl Dinam) and (196) male resting in a flower, Pucón (photo by Miguel Mellado.

bibRefCitation.author: Shannon, R. C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Shannon, R. C. (1927) A review of the South American two-winged flies of the family Syrphidae. Proceedings of the United States Natural Museum, 70, 1 - 34. https: // doi. org / 10.5479 / si. 00963801.70 - 2658.1

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality and data.
“ Valparaíso , Chile ” (HT, ♂ , USNM )
.

;

,

La
Araucanía : 2♂ , 1♀ , Termas de Rio blanco, no date, Leg. J. Herrera ( IEUMCE )
;
Los Ríos : 1♂ , km 6 to Parque Oncol ,
25.II.2016
, Leg. R. Barahona-Segovia ( PCRBS )
.
Chilean distribution. From Coquimbo to Los Ríos region ( Fig. 197 ).
Altitudinal range. From valleys to precordillera ecosystems (390– 1,400 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes.
Fragosa filiola
has been observed visiting several native plants such as vira-vira
Pseudognaphalium viravira (Molina) Anderb.
and
Alstroemeria aurea Graham
(R. Barahona-Segovia, pers. obs.).
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 95,140 km 2 , AOO = 64 km 2 , 13 subpopulations and 15 localities.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

. Type-species:
Baccha capitata Loew, 1863
(orig. des.).
